event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: A fatal error occurred on the interface between a MBC chip and a SC chip.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
A fatal error occurred on the interface between a MBC chip and a SC chip.



   SPARC Enterprise M3000 platform:

      The motherboard on the SPARC Enterprise M3000 platform contains a JSC chip instead of an SC chip.
      The FMRI in the ereport indicates whether the JSC chip or the MBC chip detected the fault.
      The platform is reset and becomes unbootable.



   SPARC Enterprise M4000 platform:

      If the FMRI of the ereport indicates the fault affected only a single XSB associated with this MBC,
        then the domain using the XSB is reset and the faulty XSB is deconfigured.

      Otherwise, the platform is reset and unbootable.


        
   SPARC Enterprise M5000 platform:

      If the FMRI of the ereport indicates the fault affected only a single XSB associated with this MBC,
        then the domain using the XSB is reset and the faulty XSB is deconfigured.

       Otherwise, the platform is reset and one-half the Motherboard with the MBC chip is deconfigured.



   SPARC Enterprise M8000/M9000 platforms:

      If the FMRI of the ereport indicates the fault affected only a single XSB associated with this MBC,
        then the domain using the XSB is reset and the faulty XSB is deconfigured.

      Otherwise, all domains using the CMU are reset and the CMU is deconfigured.




The recommended service action for this event is to schedule the replacement of the affected FRU's.
 
     LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU



Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 20 21:19:56 san-ff2-21-0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: 7860000772  
   EVENT-ID: b18d3960-93b5-4873-9982-08676f3a75af
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8003-GJ for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID: SCF-8003-GJ, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Critical
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 20 21:19:56 UTC 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: 7860000772, HOSTNAME: san-ff2-21-0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: b18d3960-93b5-4873-9982-08676f3a75af
   DESC: A fatal error occurred on the interface between a MBC chip and a SC chip.
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8003-GJ for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: Resources associated with the faulty FRU will be deconfigured. Please consult the
   detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
   IMPACT: Either the platform or a domain is reset. The platform may become unbootable.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
   REC-ACTION: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU),
   the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command

   
   SPARC Enterprise platform example:
 
   xscf> fmdump -v -u b18d3960-93b5-4873-9982-08676f3a75af

         TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
         Mar 20 21:19:56.7470 b18d3960-93b5-4873-9982-08676f3a75af SCF-8003-GJ
           66%  fault.chassis.SPARC-Enterprise.if.fe-mbc-sc

                Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0/mbc=0
                   Affects: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0
                       FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=7860000772:
                       server-id=san-ff2-21-0:
                       part=CA20393-B50X 001AA:revision=0101/component=/MBU_B

           33%  fault.chassis.SPARC-Enterprise.if.fe-mbc-sc

                Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0
                   Affects: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0
                       FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=7860000772:
                            server-id=san-ff2-21-0:
                            part=CA20393-B50X 001AA:revision=0101/component=/MBU_B


Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.



If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.

event_registry_properties.item: Either the platform or a domain is reset. The platform may become unbootable. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: Resources associated with the faulty FRU will be deconfigured. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Fatal error occurred on the interface between a MBC chip and a SC chip.
